positions.title: Sr. Product Manager
positions.summary:
As Sr. Product Manager, I steer the direction of our cloud security solutions through feedback from our clients and prospects and insight from my experience in the cloud security space.
I also assist with architecture and engineering for a cloud-native migration of our existing on-prem products, which we intend to provide as a service in the future.
positions.description:
Meet with clients and obtain feedback.
Articulate client feedback to developers.
Develop proof-of-concept/prototype of solutions based on client feedback.
Demo/share/discuss prototype/proof-of-concept with the development team and handoff to develop into a production version.

positions.title: Cloud Application Security Architect
positions.summary: As Cloud Application Security Architect, I serve as a technical leader in designing and developing secure software, ensuring we build applications using industry standards for modern Cloud systems, and establishing strategy, policies, procedures, and best practice security methodology.
positions.description:
Inventory and understand existing, internally developed applications and systems.
Develop cloud-native architectures that will support those applications and systems, or, where necessary, work with development teams to articulate technical gaps or barriers to cloud migration.
Assist with architecture and engineering for our on-premises Kubernetes platform.
Work with security vendors to assess and refine our security capabilities and controls for our cloud environments and Kubernetes platform.

positions.title: Director, DevOps and Security Automation
positions.summary: As Director of DevOps and Security Automation, I lead a team that builds custom solutions for cloud security and automation.
positions.description:
My team meets with clients and prospects to understand technical security or automation challenges.
We articulate the technical challenge and obtain client feedback, validating and synchronizing the problem between our teams.
We develop and propose a solution and obtain client feedback to revise (if necessary).
If the client moves forward with the proposal, we begin development and testing, provide the solution to the client, and implement the solution (if part of the agreement).

positions.title: Solutions Architect
positions.summary: As Solutions Architect, I attend client-facing meetings with our sales team, develop proposals, and perform implementation/support for custom cloud or security automation solutions.
positions.description:
Listen to the client to understand technical, procedural, or staffing challenges.
Whiteboard to illustrate technical or procedural challenges and facilitate understanding across technical and non-technical meeting participants.
If the topic is technical, explore/develop initial solutions, which I develop further into a formal proposal.
Write Statements of Work (SoWs) to develop/implement/support solutions.
Implement custom solutions as defined in SoW.
Provide support for the solutions after implementation

positions.title: Site Reliability Engineer
positions.summary:
As Site Reliability Engineer, I am responsible for building and operating our greenfield Security-as-a-Service platform using AWS and Kubernetes.
I am also responsible for this platform's scalability, observability.
positions.description:
Automate everything.
Build quality, highly reliable, and scalable, cloud native services.
Focus on AWS/GCP, serverless (lambda/functions), and Kubernetes.

positions.title: Managing Architect - MSS R&D
positions.summary:
As Managing Architect in R&D, I lead a DevOps team that builds and maintains the automation of R&D's infrastructure.
Our team focuses on building automation and scalability into our infrastructure, migrating our existing services to cloud, and re-architect our monolithic services into micro-services to support cloud-native environments.
positions.description:
Our team manages the code build pipeline, container and system management, deployment, monitoring, testing, and everything else DevOps related. We aim to build security-related applications as micro-services that can scale up and down as necessary in a cloud-native environment.
The outcome is that we save costs for the business, maintain maximum availability for our internal and external customers, and efficiently utilize resources with on-demand infrastructure to support our internal and external APIs, big data analytics, and machine learning.

positions.title: Solutions Architect
positions.summary: As Solutions Architect, I work with our pre-sales team to identify, qualify, and scope projects for our clients.
positions.description:
Work with Account Managers throughout the selling process by participating in business development calls.
Assist Account Managers in selling established contracts and developing relationships with prospects. Manage the proposal process and create SOW's and RFP's.
Coordinate follow-up sales activities (i.e. evaluation, implementation, customer training).
Maintain relationships with clients by providing support, information, and guidance as well as research and recommend new solutions and services.
Obtain and maintain top tier vendor certification.

positions.title: Security Architect
positions.summary: As Security Architect, I work in a "Customer Success" capacity to ensure our product/service delivers the value our clients expect.
positions.description:
Scope and complete the implementation of RiskIQ solutions, at customer sites and remotely.
Meet with customers, gather both product and integration requirements, and be able to demonstrate and explain the various aspects of the RiskIQ solutions.
Architect customer workflows, processes, and documentation. Interact with customers in a collaborative, consultative manner to deliver results, provide feedback, and make recommendations.
Independently decompose and solve complex client problems with minimal direction. Leverage the RiskIQ tool to deliver intelligence reports on emerging threats.
Deliver world-class "white glove" customer enablement and customer support.
Architect and implement integrations of the RiskIQ solutions at the client site â€“ e.g., integrate with SIEM or GRC tools, customer dashboards, and next-generation intelligence tools (e.g., Palantir). Develop add-ons to the RiskIQ APIs to solve customer needs. Research emerging security topics and new attack vectors in both the web and mobile spaces.
Publish and present my work to RiskIQ subscribers and the world.

positions.title: Technical Account Manager
positions.summary:
As Technical Account Manager, I work with targeted client accounts.
I own and drive projects from inception to completion, identify and document project requirements, support clients on various information security initiatives, keep all stakeholders apprised of project and budget status, and manage issues to resolution.
I am also responsible for assembling project teams, assigning individual responsibilities, identifying appropriate resources needed, and developing a schedule to ensure the timely completion of projects and issues.
Some of my responsibilities include the following:
positions.description:
Independently lead projects from inception to completion.
Build and develop relationships with internal and external stakeholders.
Ensure alignment between demand and capacity.
Effectively delegate and ensure the timely completion of all open tickets with the client.
Lead information security projects from inception to completion.
Build appropriate mitigation plans for the overall project initiatives.
Develop a project plan detailing schedules, controls, resources, costs, and daily tasks.
Assure overall project and service offering quality and consistency.
Validate, manage, and control the scope of the offering and the project.
Meet regularly with the team to aid in identifying issues and strategies.
Actively monitor project budget, deliverables, and open tickets.
Coordinate and manage projects across various functional groups, communicating impacts.
Establish communication plans to facilitate core project team coordination and to provide status to management and extended project team members.
Manage projects to quality and profitability standards.
Implement project management controls to ensure projects are delivered on time, within budget, adhere to high-quality standards, and meet customer expectations.

positions.title: Sr. Managed Security Services Engineer
positions.summary: As Sr. Managed Security Services Engineer, I oversee day-to-day operations for our clients' security infrastructure.
positions.description:
Responsible for leading the integration and implementation of security devices and products that enable the delivery of managed security services into a variety of simple to complex network environments. Manage all aspects of the integration process for Managed Security Services; including network and security design review and recommendations, technical data gathering, security and policy review and configuration, troubleshooting, coordination of equipment and system staging, configuration, installation, and activation of services for delivery by the Security Operations Center.
Utilize in-depth knowledge of TCP/IP networking and routing communication protocols, as well as hands-on experience and in-depth knowledge, understanding, and a strong competency in best-of-breed Firewall and IDS/IPS security products (CheckPoint, Cisco, Juniper, SourceFire, Palo Alto). Review and provide consulting to customers on their security and architectural design.
Responsible for multi-vendor/multi-device/platform implementations with geographically dispersed customers, partners, and other service providers. Lead troubleshooting efforts for complex network environments to identify and eliminate network or security configuration issues.

positions.title: Network Security Consultant
positions.summary: As Network Security Consultant, I implement/integrate security solutions for our consulting services practice.
positions.description:
Provide on-site implementation and consulting services for the security products/services that FNS represents, including, but not limited to Check Point, Juniper, Secure Computing, F5, McAfee, Blue Coat, and others.
Provide leadership by aiding in product research, following up on open issues, and acting as an escalation of contact.
Assist Team Leader with day-to-day issues as they relate to Engineering engagements.
Communicate critical client issues to management and escalation engineering staff.
Provide weekly reports of Engineering activity as defined by management.
Assist other Engineering or Support Center staff with lab systems configurations to replicate client issues.
Assist in the creation of client systems profiles and statements of work.
Act as front-line point of escalation on assigned client engagements.
Maintain technical knowledge and troubleshooting skills on the FNS supported products and services.
Dispatch to customer sites to assist and/or facilitate repair or installation of supported products.

positions.title: Escalation Engineer
positions.summary: As Escalation Engineer, I provide advanced support in L2/L3, system down, and other escalation scenarios.
positions.description:
De-escalate/defuse when necessary.
Debug network and applications to determine root cause.
Implement workarounds (where necessary).
Apply custom patches/fixes (where necessary).
Own problem from initial incident through successful fix/solution.
Manage calls between client and vendor (where necessary).

positions.title: Support Engineer
positions.summary: As Support Engineer, I answer inbound support requests (email and phone calls) for products which we provide authorized support.
